name: Mexican Corn-off-the-Cob Salad
author: HeidiS
summary: This salad was inspired by the recipes I've seen for grilled Mexican corn on the cob--mayo, lime, cotija cheese--just adjusted for those that would rather not eat corn on the cob or to save time (and grill space) during your bbq! Can be served cold or at room temp.
ingredients: ½  lime, juiced, or more to taste
¼ cup packed chopped fresh cilantro
1 pinch ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate
Grill corn in the husks on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, to desired tenderness, about 15 minutes; some charring is fine
Remove and discard husks and silk when cool enough to handle
Cut kernels off into a medium bowl
Add lime juice and chili powder, then mix in cotija cheese, cilantro, mayonnaise, and pepper until thoroughly combined
Taste and add salt if necessary
